source.b84ce287:
# Command to see if you are using notebook with CPU/GPU

# Colab Tab: Runtime ==> Change Run Time ==> None(CPU)/GPU/TPU

%tensorflow_version 2.x
import tensorflow as tf
device_name = tf.test.gpu_device_name()
if device_name != '/device:GPU:0':
  raise SystemError('GPU device not found')
print('Found GPU at: {}'.format(device_name))

source.b4fd4f51:
# Let's download submision.csv files.

import time
import os
submission_path = os.path.join(root,"submission")
if not os.path.exists(submission_path):
    os.mkdir(submission_path)
save_submission_path = os.path.join(submission_path,"%s.csv"%(time.ctime())) 
submission_data.to_csv(save_submission_path,index=False)

files.download(save_submission_path)

source.9f4f1967: #### This notebook is to help beginer like me who doesn't have GPU and less familiar with colab. With This notebook, I will help to setup the kaggle over colab and saving dataset/Model Enviroment on your google drive
source.431b4482:
#### SetUp Kaggle

Move to Kaggle Account: Your Profile ==> Account Tab ==> Create API Token

It will download kaggle.json and this has to be uploaded to Colab to link Kaggle with Colab
